title: I'm curious, does anyone really ever use Font of Life? Usually I only ever see Bone-Plate/Demolish
body:
I personally like the Rune when my team has a lot of Auto-attackers, makes fights a bit easier when everyone is sustaining on targets I slow/CC.

Anyone else?

replies.body: Font of Life actually makes {{champion:10}} support viable so I usually take it on her.

> [{quoted}](name=PhearBunny,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=stYEnQVe,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2018-06-11T19:47:39.838+0000)
>
> no it doesn't. Kayle doesn't even build health you weirdo.

Okay. Let's do this.

Kayle has the fourth highest base health in the game. Clocking in at an amazing 2371 health at level 18.

Kayle gains 135 bonus health for going into the Resolve tree (270 for going into the Inspiration tree second) at level 18. Just to make sure we're on the same page, I'll go with the higher amount.

That's 2641 health so far.

Now let's go over her items.

{{item:3092}} (+200 health)

{{item:3504}} 

{{item:3107}} (+200 health)

{{item:3222}} 

{{item:3083}} (+800 health)

{{item:3117}} 

That's 3841 health.

Now, Font of Life heals for a flat 5 plus 1% of maximum health.

1% of 3841 is 38.41

Due to her items ({{item:3504}} {{item:3107}} {{item:3222}} ) and due to picking up Revitalize later down in the Resolve tree, all healing is increased by 45% (55% on targets below 40% health)

38.41 plus 45% = 55.6945

Font of Life lasts for 4 seconds and the healing you get from it is delayed over the course of two seconds.

So that means we just double.

55.6945 multiplied by 2 = 111.389.

111.389 plus 10 (the flat amount on Font of Life) = 121.389.

Now this may not sound like much and you have to be level 18 and full build to reach this amount, but coupled with her already big heal and her ultimate that literally makes a target immune to all damage this sounds pretty good to me.

I see we are unable to come to an agreement here.

Well lets take any tank support with max level around 5k HPs. In case of Cho, Sion or such, he can spread the FoL to whole enemy team instead of just one so that is 5x50x2 = 500 HP healing. Even to single target its 100Hps. Now comparing that to your Kayles, uh, pathetic heals as you got no AP to give good base level heals, I would also walk over you and your supported friend.

Like said, you need HPs to get it working or some other combo. With other combo I mean Soraka as I haven't found any other champion that can could use FoL to any usable amount of healing.

Soraka with {{item:3504}} {{item:3174}} {{item:3382}} {{item:3151}} is pushing 150 AP and 1855+300+200= 2355HPs.
Base FoL would be 28 that is doubled becasue of 4 sec duration to 56. That 56 would in turn be increased by 8+8+5=21% to 84 HPs. Your 'max healling power' makes arguably 44% better job.
Execpt.
Hitting enemy with Starcall will mark them and because of the Athene+Liandry combo, hitting naked lvl 18 Gnar that has 1615 max HP would mean of around 2% of targets HPs worth to be transferd as Blood charges (32) that in turn would be used to boost the FoL healing, also enjoying the 21% increase of healing, thus 38,72 healing done addition to FoL. That pushes the 84 to 122 that is same what the 'healer' kayle build would offer with one less item.
Except.
Starcall can hit multiple enemies thus spreading FoL to multiple enemies with multiple enemies affected with Torment meaning five times more blood charges meaning 32*5=160 Blood charges generated that can be used for healing, again enjoying the 21% increase of healing thus 193, pushing the FoL healing from 56 to 249. That is 205% more healing done with FoL proc than what the Kayle build was offering.
With one less item.

That said, if the rune would heal both champions, the one procing and the one marking, it would actually have some value to others than Soraka.

Now 100-150 HPs, or even 250 with perfect Soraka situation, is one basic attacks worth of HPs from someone that has zero damage builded. That is done over four seconds time while everyone can surely make more than one basic attack in that time, even Graves would do five. FoL can't even heal one super minions hit (even if it would proc from it) and then we have Demolish for a option that would do minimum of 660 damage on towers.

I take it on some of my HP heavy junglers.  Makes it a little easier to keep your laner in the fight when you can show up with a red buff.

There are some runes never used because they are put on the same line as better options........which is why they made the change and put magical footwear and stopwatch on the same line because they worked great together and saved you a chunk of gold you would have to spend.
{{champion:16}}

It's a bad rune generally. For one, it only makes sense to take bottom lane. How often do you have access to any form of CC as Janna, for example? Once with your W and another time with your Q. So, if your ADC is smart enough to autoattack the enemy you W, then it can grant 11 HP at level 1, which is ok, but then, at something like level 10, it only grants 15. 
The fact that it's very situation early game and very weak later makes it very unreliable. Instead, Bone plating is so much better, because it will block quite a lot of damage. Demolish is also bad.
